This is the final entry in my three part writeup of my first foray into Python & Raspberry Pi programming. You can find part one here and part 2 at this link!

I encourage you to check out my previous posts, but for those with limited time, I'll summarize briefly. At the outset, I had a vague goal; display a large image file on a CRT monitor or television, and allow for a user to control that panning, scrolling, and zooming around the file with a third party USB gamecube controller.

  • In part 1 I gave a brief background to the project and reviewed the hardware I chose to accomplish the task.

  • In part 2, I delved a bit deeper, walking through my process in, capturing the USB device data with Python.

Now, in part 3, it's time to assemble the pieces, complete the Python script, and tie up a few loose ends.
